hints.content: Alex arranged his cars into $3$ rows with $3$ car in each row.

This array shows $\blueE3$ rows with $\purpleD3$ squares in each row.

![A group of 3 lines with 3 squares in each line. The squares are numbered at the top 1 through 3. The squares are numbered at the left 1 through 3.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b62911228d90f8c56d1d1086ac241a5dcbfb1857)

This image shows how Alex arranged his cars: 

![A group of 3 lines with 3 squares in each line.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f861a49e2f812e66f5d60dd4ca0b270b3964d418)

question.content:
Alex arranged his toy cars. He put them in $3$ rows with $3$ cars in each row.

**Which image below shows how Alex arranged his toy cars?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A group of 3 lines with 3 squares in each line.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f861a49e2f812e66f5d60dd4ca0b270b3964d418)

![A group of 3 lines with 3 squares in the first line. The second line has 1 square. The third line has 1 square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8f4262762eba1263ff04808bf2ed23a28b420864)
![A group of 2 lines with 2 squares in each line.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4c3c0f33c34acf744cea9c0dc4f7541d2a91ae26)
